txt.en: 'I believe my people are ready to be free of this burden... but there is only one way to find out. But first, I must find my wife.\n\n'Come, my friend. She will be glad to know that you survived the ordeal as well.'
Thank you for helping my husband, [placeholder]! You did what many of us could not: stand up to the injustices of Isengard. You were a great boon to the people of Galtrev today.
Instance: The Meaning of Alliance
'We are safe, even if only for a short time. Rest, friend. Retribution may still come, but I hope it will not be soon.'

'Thank you for the help you have lent us, [placeholder]! We are now free from this oppressive menace...though I fear they will return in greater numbers to try to enslave us again.

'At least we now know the true colours of Isengard!

'There is nothing more to be done here tonight. We should all rest and recover.'
An angry White Hand overseer approaches...

'Thank you for the help you have lent us, [placeholder]! We are now free from this oppressive menace...though I fear they will return in greater numbers to try to enslave us again.

'At least we now know the true colours of Isengard!

'There is nothing more to be done here tonight. We should all rest and recover.'
The overseer does not seem very forgiving
A White Hand overseer has been defeated; this act of defiance will surely enrage the servants of Isengard
Tomos stands nearby.\n\nYou should speak with Tomos.
Tomos has died
Tomos is searching for his wife, Mari.\n\nYou should follow Tomos through Galtrev.
Tomos is searching for his wife, Mari.\n\nYou should follow Tomos to Mari's side.
An angry White Hand overseer has appeared to make Tomos answer for his crime of missing the day's work.\n\nYou should speak with the overseer to try to appease him.
The half-orc to whom you spoke seems unreasonably angry.\n\nYou should defend yourself and the townsfolk from the wrath of the servants of Isengard.
Defeat the servants of the White Hand.
Mari is in Galtrev.\n\nYou should speak with Mari.
Talk to Tomos
Follow Tomos
Follow Tomos
Try to appease the White Hand overseer
Help defend the people of Galtrev
Help the people of Galtrev
Talk to Mari
Tomos must not fall
The people of Galtrev wish to free themselves from the unfairly one-sided alliance with Isengard's White Hand presence.

'Two little mongrels went rogue today and missed their day's work, [placeholder]. How do you propose to make up that labour to Saruman?\n\n'You had best start running, little [placeholder], you and your friend Tomos. I will not be merciful....'
